definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The football bounced off the goalpost.
sentences.chinese: 足球击中球门门柱弹了出去。

sentences.english: Joshi's proposed shift significantly moves the economic goalposts for digital print.
sentences.chinese: 乔希提出的举动明显转变经济球门柱的数码印刷。

sentences.english: Her shot went whistling past the goalpost .
sentences.chinese: 她的射门呼啸着越过球门柱。

sentences.english: He could see only the hazy outline of the goalposts.
sentences.chinese: 他只能看见球门柱模糊的轮廓。

sentences.english: Henry hung around for a few minutes, then gave the gatepost a kick and went home.
sentences.chinese: 亨利等了几分钟，然后踢了一脚门柱就回家了。

sentences.english: The thermostat on the balcony's doorpost?
sentences.chinese: 这条阳台门柱上的恒温器？

sentences.english: Strike-partner Andriy Shevchenko also went close, slamming an effort against the woodwork.
sentences.chinese: 锋线搭档舍甫琴科也有机会，但他的射门打在门柱上。

sentences.english: I used to use my brother as a goalpost.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经把我的弟弟当球门柱用过。

sentences.english: The ball bounced off the left upright of the goal.
sentences.chinese: 球碰到左侧球门柱后弹开。

sentences.english: I knocked my head on the doorpost and hurt it.
sentences.chinese: 我的头撞在门柱上，碰破了。

sentences.english: Bosnia and Herzegovina a few times in the game hit the goal post, which makes Portugal a false alarm.
sentences.chinese: 波黑在比赛中几次击中门柱，这让葡萄牙虚惊一场。

sentences.english: I ran into the gatepost and hurt my knee.
sentences.chinese: 我撞到门柱上，伤了膝盖。

sentences.english: The Chinese paste spring couplets on the gateposts when celebrating Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 中国人在庆祝春节的时候会在门柱上贴春联。

sentences.english: His shot hit into the goalpost , and all the audience sighed.
sentences.chinese: 他的射门击中了门柱，全场观众一片叹声。

sentences.english: The ball rebounded from the goalpost and Owen headed it in.
sentences.chinese: 球从门柱弹回，欧文头球将球攻进。

sentences.english: The football bounced off the goalpost .
sentences.chinese: 足球击中球门柱弹了出去。

definition: to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
